p: We selected 36 locations ( Fig 1A) representing concentrated dairy production areas across nine U.S. regions (3 to 4 sites/region) that are climatically consistent and useful for identifying trends and geospatial distributions in climate [ 31] ( Fig 1B). We selected three periods in the 21 st century [early (2015 to 2034), mid (2045 to 2064), and late (2081 to 2100)] and included one period in the 20 th century (1981 to 2000) to serve as a benchmark for projected changes. Future milk production losses per cow from heat stress were estimated using site-specific climate projections and four levels of housing heat abatement. An economic analysis of housing-based heat abatements was completed using cost-benefit ratios.
